description: From Neapolitan and Spanish paisano, Italian paesano, French paysan. Doublet of peasant.

entries.meaning: Among Italian Americans and Americans of Italian descent: a fellow Italian or Italian-American; a fellow ethnic Italian.
A native, especially a native of California of mixed Spanish and Indian ancestry.

examples: Within a very few minutes the cattleman was mounted and away. Paisano, well named after that ungainly but swift-running bird, struck into his long lope that ate up the ground like a strip of macaroni.
